claim_text: to identify a set of features that are both useful for the detection of dementia and that we expect to transfer across different languages
evidence_text: As a high-level observation, in both the uni- and multilingual cases, relatively more info features are selected, and relatively fewer LM features. Of the LM features that are selected, those which relate to the maximum perplexity or minimum probability appear to be more useful. These features capture locally anomalous speech patterns, relative to either the AD or control language models.
justification_conclusion: True. The features that are selected are useful for the detection of dementia and transfer across different languages.

claim_text: to improve classification results on the French dataset by augmenting the training set with English data.
evidence_text: When training entirely on English data and testing on French, the results using info and info+LM features are significantly improved over the unilingual baseline, while the LM results are reduced, once again indicating that the info features transfer better across languages. The results are very similar to those using the ALL technique for domain adaptation, suggesting that in that case, model training is dominated by the English data.
justification_conclusion: True. The classification results on the French dataset are improved by augmenting the training set with English data.
